intro: Elatostema kusaiense, commonly known as the Kusai sandwort, is a small herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Elatostema kusaiense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
